TITLE: A record 4.5 million workers quit their jobs in November
SUMMARY: Workers quit their jobs in record numbers in November while the total openings pulled back a bit, the Labor Department reported Tuesday.

TITLE: Here's where the jobs landed — in one chart
SUMMARY: The leisure and hospitality sector led hiring in December as restaurants added wait staff, cooks and bartenders ahead of the holidays.

TITLE: Hiring falters in December as payrolls rise only 199,000, though the unemployment rate fell to 3.9%
SUMMARY: Nonfarm payrolls were expected to increase by 422,000 in December, according to economists surveyed by Dow Jones.

TITLE: Jamie Dimon sees the best economic growth in decades, more than 4 Fed rate hikes this year
SUMMARY: JPMorgan is the biggest U.S. bank by assets and has relationships with half of U.S. households.

TITLE: Goldman predicts the Fed will hike rates four times this year, more than previously expected
SUMMARY: High inflation and near-full employment will push the Fed to raise rates more quickly than expected, according to Goldman Sachs.

TITLE: Fed Chair Powell says rate hikes, tighter policy will be needed to control inflation
SUMMARY: Federal Reserve Chairman Jerome Powell declared Tuesday that the economy is both healthy enough and in need of tighter monetary policy.

TITLE: Watch Fed Chair Jerome Powell testify live at his Senate confirmation hearing
SUMMARY: Federal Reserve Chairman Jerome Powell testifies Tuesday before the Senate Banking Committee as part of his confirmation process.

TITLE: Empty grocery shelves return as sick employees, supply chain delays collide
SUMMARY: Shares of major grocers fell on Tuesday, after Albertsons said omicron has compounded out-of-stocks.

TITLE: Fed Vice Chair Clarida to step down early following scrutiny over his trades during pandemic
SUMMARY: Federal Reserve Vice Chairman Richard Clarida said Monday he will be leaving his post with just a few weeks left on his term.

TITLE: The Federal Reserve is scaring markets with the triple threat of policy tightening
SUMMARY: Fed members are ready not only to start raising rates and tapering bond buying, but also cutting the size of the balance sheet.

TITLE: U.S. weekly jobless claims total 207,000, higher than expected amid omicron spread
SUMMARY: Jobless claims totaled 207,000 for the week ended Jan. 1, higher than the 195,000 estimate and 7,000 more than the previous week.

TITLE: Federal Reserve puts wheels in motion for balance sheet reduction
SUMMARY: The Federal Open Market Committee on Wednesday released minutes from its Dec. 14-15 meeting.

TITLE: Private job growth totals 807,000 in December, more than doubling expectations, ADP says
SUMMARY: Private job growth totaled 807,000 for the month, well ahead of the Dow Jones estimate for 375,000 and the November gain of 505,000.

TITLE: Markets and the economy brace as the Federal Reserve's first rate hike could come in two months
SUMMARY: If everything goes according to plan, the central bank in a little over two months will enact its first rate increase in three years.

TITLE: FDIC chair intends to resign in February, giving Biden more say over bank regulation
SUMMARY: In a surprise announcement, FDIC Chair Jelena McWilliams said she is resigning effective Feb. 4.

TITLE: Inflation rises 7% over the past year, highest since 1982
SUMMARY: The consumer price index for December 2021 was expected to increase 7% from a year ago, according to economists surveyed by Dow Jones.

TITLE: Fear of even higher mortgage rates may be heating up winter homebuying
SUMMARY: Rates have started this year sharply higher, and that may have potential buyers rushing in more quickly, afraid that rates will go even higher.

TITLE: Here's where the jobs are — in one chart
SUMMARY: The leisure and hospitality sector led hiring in December as restaurants added wait staff, cooks and bartenders ahead of the holidays.

TITLE: Inflation surge could push the Fed into more than four rate hikes this year, Goldman Sachs says
SUMMARY: Goldman economist David Mericle said the omicron spread is aggravating price increases and could push the Fed into a faster pace of rate hikes.

TITLE: Fed releases long-awaited study on a digital dollar but doesn't take a position yet on creating one
SUMMARY: The Fed released its exploration of a digital dollar, exploring the pros and cons of the much-debated issue and soliciting public comment.

TITLE: Jobless claims jump to 286,000, the highest level since October
SUMMARY: Initial filings totaled 286,000, well above the estimate of 225,000 and a substantial gain from the previous week's 231,000.

TITLE: The Fed is about to see a lot of new faces. What it means for banks, the economy and markets
SUMMARY: In what likely will just a few months' time, the Federal Reserve will look a lot different.

TITLE: Retail sales dropped 1.9% in December as higher prices caused consumers to curb spending
SUMMARY: The advance monthly sales report to close out the year showed a decline of 1.9%, considerably worse than the Dow Jones estimate for just a 0.1% drop.

TITLE: Fed's Harker calls for 'action on inflation,' sees 3 or 4 rate hikes likely this year
SUMMARY: Philadelphia Federal Reserve President Patrick Harker said he foresees three or four interest rate hikes this year as likely to fight inflation.

TITLE: Wholesale prices jump nearly 10% in 2021, another sign of growing inflation
SUMMARY: The producer price index was expected to rise 0.4% in December. Jobless claims were forecast to total 200,000.

TITLE: CNBC Fed Survey forecasts more aggressive Fed tightening
SUMMARY: At the Fed's two-day meeting, which ends Wednesday, it is expected to give more clues as to when it will hike rates and begin shrinking the balance sheet.

TITLE: Home prices surged in November, but at a slower rate than in October, S&P Case-Shiller says
SUMMARY: Even as the housing market entered its traditionally slower season in November, home prices showed big gains from a year ago.

TITLE: IMF cuts 2022 global growth forecast as U.S., China recovery wanes
SUMMARY: The International Monetary Fund has downgraded its global growth forecast for 2022 as rising Covid cases, supply chain disruptions and inflation hamper the economy.

TITLE: The Fed is likely to signal a March interest rate hike and that further policy tightening is coming
SUMMARY: Even with the market's violent correction, a hawkish Federal Reserve is expected to signal it plans to raise interest rates and consider other tightening.

TITLE: Mortgage refinance demand plunges 13% as interest rates climb toward two-year high
SUMMARY: As mortgage rates continue to rise, demand for refinances is plunging and homebuyers are struggling.

TITLE: GDP grew at a 6.9% pace to close out 2021, stronger than expected despite omicron spread
SUMMARY: Gross domestic product accelerated at a 6.9% annualized pace in the fourth quarter, well ahead of the 5.5% estimate.

TITLE: Federal Reserve points to interest rate hike coming in March
SUMMARY: The Federal Reserve on Wednesday indicated it could soon will raise interest rates for the first time in more than three years.

TITLE: Here's what changed in the new Fed statement
SUMMARY: This is a comparison of Wednesday's Federal Open Market Committee statement with the one issued after the Fed's previous policymaking meeting on Dec. 15.

TITLE: Key Fed inflation gauge rises 4.9% from a year ago, fastest gain since 1983
SUMMARY: A gauge the Federal Reserve prefers to measure inflation rose 4.9% from a year ago, the biggest gain going back to September 1983.

TITLE: There were 4.6 million more job openings than unemployed workers in December
SUMMARY: Job openings totaled nearly 11 million in December while the Great Resignation cooled off, according to Labor Department data Tuesday.

TITLE: Suburban sprawl is weighing on the U.S. economy
SUMMARY: Real estate zoning restrictions have produced a national housing shortage and affordability crisis. Architects and economists say reform could boost growth.

TITLE: Companies unexpectedly cut 301,000 jobs in January as omicron slams labor market, ADP says
SUMMARY: Private payrolls fell by 301,000 for the month versus the estimate for a 200,000 gain, according to payrolls processing firm ADP.

TITLE: Borrowers rush to get the last of the low mortgage rates, with refinances jumping 18%
SUMMARY: Mortgage rates have been rising swiftly, and that has borrowers rushing in to get the last of the low rates.

TITLE: After a huge year for growth, the U.S. economy is about to slam into a wall
SUMMARY: The U.S. economy last year grew at its fastest pace since 1984. Don't expect a repeat performance in 2022.

TITLE: Long-term unemployment tumbles in January
SUMMARY: The share of workers unemployed for more than six months fell significantly from December, on the back of an unexpectedly strong January jobs report.

TITLE: Fed influence, shaky forecasts, delayed decisions: How the Biden administration misread the inflation threat
SUMMARY: The Biden administration misread the rising threat of inflation for a variety of reasons, according to several economists and current and former officials.

TITLE: Black unemployment rate dips, labor force participation rises in January
SUMMARY: The Black unemployment rate dipped to 6.9% in January from 7.1%.

TITLE: Payrolls show surprisingly powerful gain of 467,000 in January despite omicron surge
SUMMARY: Nonfarm payrolls were expected to increase 150,000 in January, according to economists surveyed by Dow Jones.

TITLE: Republicans grill Fed nominee Raskin over past views on climate and big energy companies
SUMMARY: Senate Republicans on Thursday peppered Sarah Bloom Raskin with questions over whether she would steer the institution into climate change.

TITLE: Weekly jobless claims total 238,000, fewer than expected
SUMMARY: Initial filings for unemployment claims totaled a bit fewer than expected last week as companies looked to overcome the impact of the omicron spread.

TITLE: January's payrolls report on Friday could be rough, with as many as 400,000 jobs lost by one estimate
SUMMARY: A jobs market that was on fire for most of 2021 looks like it sustained a cold splash of reality to start the new year.

TITLE: Consumer debt totals $15.6 trillion in 2021, a record-breaking increase
SUMMARY: Total debt at the end of the year came to $15.6 trillion, an increase of $333 billion in the fourth quarter and just over $1 trillion for the year.

TITLE: Drug overdoses are costing the U.S. economy $1 trillion a year, government report estimates
SUMMARY: U.S. government officials said synthetic opioids are akin to “a slow-motion weapon of mass destruction.”

TITLE: Seven hikes? Fast-rising wages could cause the Fed to raise interest rates even higher this year
SUMMARY: Too much of a good thing, in the form of rapidly rising wages, is expected to push Federal Reserve interest rate hikes at an even faster pace.

TITLE: Fed's Bostic says more than 3 hikes possible this year, but needs to see how economy responds
SUMMARY: Bostic said he anticipates hiking interest rates three or four times this year, but the central bank isn't locked into a specific plan.

TITLE: Homebuyer demand for mortgages drops 10%, as higher interest rates price some people out
SUMMARY: Rising mortgage rates are finally taking a toll on homebuyers, who are already stretched by high home prices. As a result, demand for mortgages fell.

TITLE: Biden touts wage growth, slower inflation forecasts after another surge in prices
SUMMARY: Biden touted wages and forecasts for weaker price growth even after the consumer inflation report showed prices are rising at their fastest clip in 40 years.

TITLE: Inflation surges 7.5% on an annual basis, even more than expected and highest since 1982
SUMMARY: The consumer price index was expected to increase 7.2% from a year ago, according to a Dow Jones economist survey.

TITLE: Inflation and high gas prices are contributing to 'a lot of financial anxiety,' survey finds
SUMMARY: Many Americans are worried about rising prices and paying bills, a survey from eMoney Advisor finds. The results show over a third are not investing at all.

TITLE: Inflation eroded pay by 1.7% over the past year
SUMMARY: Workers have seen their hourly pay jump at about the fastest clip in 15 years. But high annual inflation has eaten into those raises.

TITLE: The Fed is still likely to take a measured approach to rate hikes despite calls for bigger action
SUMMARY: Atlanta Fed President Raphael Bostic told CNBC on Thursday after the inflation report, "My views have not changed."

TITLE: Fed’s favorite inflation gauge up 5.2% for biggest annual gain since 1983
SUMMARY: A key inflation measure showed that prices rose at their fastest level in nearly 39 years, the Commerce Department reported Friday.

TITLE: Jobless claims total 232,000, slightly less than expected; Q4 GDP revised up to 7%
SUMMARY: Weekly jobless claims came in slightly less than expected last week and economic growth to end 2021 was slightly better than originally reported.

TITLE: Fed approves rules banning its officials from trading stocks, bonds and also cryptocurrencies
SUMMARY: Fed officials won't be able to trade stocks and bonds — as well as cryptocurrencies — under new rules that became formal Friday.

TITLE: The Fed is going to hike rates regardless if Biden's nominees are confirmed, economists say
SUMMARY: While there are reasons to confirm Biden's Fed nominees, economists say concern that the central bank won't act to rein in inflation shouldn't be among them.

TITLE: January home sales jump 6.7% despite a record low supply
SUMMARY: Sales of existing homes jumped far more than expected, even as supply hit another record low and prices rose significantly.

TITLE: Fed's Bullard says inflation 'could get out of control,' so action is needed now
SUMMARY: St. Louis Fed President James Bullard cautioned that without action on interest rates, inflation could become an even more serious problem.

TITLE: Bank of America CEO Brian Moynihan says U.S. consumer spending 'very strong' in February
SUMMARY: Bank of America's relationships with U.S. households, small businesses and corporations give Moynihan a unique view into the health of the economy.

TITLE: Homebuilders' confidence falls as they wait months for cabinets, garage doors and appliances
SUMMARY: Production delays for homebuilders are increasing costs and pricing out buyers. All that is weighing on builder sentiment.

TITLE: Retail sales surge 3.8% in January, much more than expected amid inflation rise
SUMMARY: Retail sales for the month rose 3.8% in January, much better than the 2.1% Dow Jones estimate.

TITLE: The average size of a new mortgage just set a record, as home prices continue to climb
SUMMARY: Rising mortgage rates are crushing refinance demand, and higher home prices are causing purchase loan sizes to grow.

TITLE: Vote on Biden Fed picks delayed as GOP presses for answers on Raskin's ties to firm
SUMMARY: A Republican boycott Tuesday held up a Senate committee vote on the appointment of a top banking regulator and Federal Reserve Chairman Jerome Powell.

TITLE: Fed's Bullard says the central bank's 'credibility is on the line,' needs to 'front-load' rate hikes
SUMMARY: St. Louis Fed President James Bullard made his case for a rapid move higher in rates, saying that the central bank needs to react to inflation.

TITLE: A new inflation reading shows the small business tipping point has been reached
SUMMARY: More small business owners say they need to raise prices and don't expect inflation to decline, a signal that higher prices have overtaken Main Street.

TITLE: Fed's Daly advocates for a 'measured' approach as rate hike expectations rise
SUMMARY: The Federal Reserve should be measured in its path to raise interest rates, San Francisco Fed President Mary Daly said Sunday.

TITLE: February jobs rose a surprisingly strong 678,000, unemployment edged lower while wages were flat
SUMMARY: Nonfarm payrolls for the month grew by 678,000 and the unemployment rate was 3.8%, the Labor Department reported Friday.

TITLE: February jobs report expected to show strong labor market continuing with solid wage gains
SUMMARY: The economy was likely to have added jobs at a healthy pace in February and wages gains were strong.

TITLE: Retailers start to warn of business impact from Russia's invasion of Ukraine
SUMMARY: Some retailers, including Victoria's Secret, are warning about business impacts from the Ukraine crisis. Others, like Nike, have suspended operations in Russia.

TITLE: Jobless claims total 215,000, fewer than expected; productivity rises 6.6%
SUMMARY: Initial claims for unemployment insurance totaled 215,000, the lowest total since the beginning of the year.

TITLE: Fed Chair Powell notes 'highly uncertain' Ukraine impact, but says rate hikes are still coming
SUMMARY: Fed Chairman Jerome Powell still sees  rate hikes coming but noted that the Russia-Ukraine war has injected uncertainty into the outlook.

TITLE: Companies added 475,000 jobs in February, better than expected, ADP says
SUMMARY: Companies added 475,000 positions for the month, better than the Dow Jones estimate for 400,000.

TITLE: Weak mortgage demand could get a big boost as Ukraine crisis causes interest rates to drop sharply
SUMMARY: Mortgage demand fell last week as rates rose, but that may all change this week as rates drop again, and sharply.

TITLE: Inflation rose 7.9% in February, as food and energy costs push prices to highest in more than 40 years
SUMMARY: The consumer price index for February was expected to rise 7.8% over the past year, according to Dow Jones estimates.

TITLE: The Federal Reserve is shrinking its $9 trillion bond program. Here's what that means for your portfolio
SUMMARY: The Federal Reserve sent $9 trillion into U.S. bond markets amid recent emergencies. Reducing the balance of this portfolio could spark a recession.

TITLE: Brief drop in mortgage rates sparks mini refinance boom
SUMMARY: Borrowers rushed to take advantage of a brief drop in rates, but those rates are already on the rise again.

TITLE: War fallout: U.S. economy to slow, Europe risks recession and Russia to suffer double-digit decline
SUMMARY: The CNBC Rapid Update, the average of 14 forecasts for the U.S. economy, sees GDP rising by 3.2% this year, a modest 0.3% markdown from the February forecast.

TITLE: Federal Reserve expected to raise interest rates in week ahead, as Ukraine crisis adds volatility
SUMMARY: Investors may take the Federal Reserve's first post-pandemic rate hike in stride, while uncertainty surrounding Ukraine continues to hang over markets.

TITLE: Forecasters see growing chance of a recession as Fed hikes rates this year to fight inflation
SUMMARY: The probability of recession in the U.S. was raised to 33% in the next 12 months, up 10 percentage points from the Feb. 1 survey.

TITLE: Wholesale inflation climbed 0.8% in February, lower than estimate but still up 10% from last year
SUMMARY: The headline producer price index rose 0.8% in February, which actually was slightly lower than the 0.9% Dow Jones estimate.

TITLE: Single-family rent prices are surging at a record rate, led by homes in Sun Belt cities like Miami and Phoenix
SUMMARY: Single-family rents were up 38.6% in Miami, compared with just a 2% jump for the city in January 2021.

TITLE: Why the Federal Reserve raises interest rates to combat inflation
SUMMARY: Consumers hit with higher prices due to inflation likely aren't looking forward to interest rate hikes from the Federal Reserve. Here's why the Fed does that.
